meanings.definition: Ten times as much or as many.
meanings.sent1: The decuple amount of candies made the children very happy.
meanings.sent2: She bought a decuple number of balloons for the party.
meanings.sent3: The decuple servings of ice cream were too much for the small bowl.
meanings.sent4: The decuple stars in the sky shone brightly on the clear night.
meanings.sent5: The decuple size of the cake towered over the other desserts on the table.

meanings.sent1: He decided to decuple his savings to reach his financial goal faster.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to decuple their efforts for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: She had to decuple her usual baking ingredients for the big family gathering.
meanings.sent4: The company aimed to decuple its production capacity by the end of the year.
meanings.sent5: The athlete trained hard to decuple his previous record in the next race.
